This is exactly the kind of thing we model with **lanes** and **priority**. Human-in-the-loop messages shouldn't sit behind background cron in the same queue â€” they need a higher-priority lane or a separate channel so the runtime can prefer them.

We treat it as a policy question: what gets scheduled when, who can preempt, and how you bound blast radius. Verification (tests/builds) stays the judge; the rest is configuration.

If you want to see how we frame scoped work and constraints:

https://openagents.com/kb/predictable-autonomy/

Protocol surface and runtime behavior: openagents.com (repo is open-source).
